title: 6.5.08. violin vs. viola: the basics
content:
*Please subscribe to see more videos like this*

My good friend Alex was in town this week from New York City, and I thought it would be fun if we made a quick video that covered the basic differences between the viola and the violin. Although the violin is a beautiful instrument, you just can't the kind of robust tone from a violin that you would from a viola. I hope to get a viola for myself one day!

Also, I'll have an video update on my album recording next week. Stay tuned. :)

title: Hello/Goodbye [work in progress] - Paul Dateh Original
content:
it's been well over a year since i've released new material. it's not that i haven't been writing or recording; it's just that i've been struggling to figure out what kind of music i want to make next.

after many, many months of trial and error, i feel that i'm now finally at a point where i'm comfortable in starting to let you listen in on my progress.

here's a draft recording of a song i've codenamed "hello/goodbye". the title might change as the song gets closer to completion, but it at least fits the bill, for now.

i'll keep working on this track (and others as well), but i hope you enjoy this draft version in the meantime.

talk to you soon,
pd

title: Paul Dateh - New Site & Album Coming Soon
content:
*Please subscribe!*

The music in this video is something I came up with earlier today, and I wanted to record it before I forgot it. It's kind of growing on me, and I'm thinking about developing it further so I can put it on my upcoming album.

Speaking of the album, I've been working on new music to put on the project. As soon as pre-production ends in January, the real recording will begin. I hope to have everything mixed and mastered by April, which means I better be smart about what I do with my time!

I know the music in this video isn't anything like the music from my previous video, but don't worry: the album will have plenty of hip hop on it. ;)

Oh yeah, the new site is coming in January. (http://pauldateh.com)

title: 01.25.10 without you here - live
content:
in memory of jessie mendoza & jacob santiago
january 29th, 2006.

find out the full story behind this song at http://pauldateh.com/2008/04/12/41208-we-all-belong/

without you here
written by paul dateh
performed by paul dateh & ken belcher

[verse 1]
I wish that I could
Go back to the time
That I saw you last
Before all this came to pass

I should have stayed a little longer
To talk and laugh with you
But instead I'm sitting here alone
Coping with the fact that you had to go

[chorus]
Since you've been gone
Things just ain't the same
And though life moves on
Your memory remains
I'll try to be strong to overcome the pain
Of living without you here

[verse 2]
Your mother misses you
Your sister and your father, too
Your little brother don't know what to do

He always looked up to you
So now he'll have to look a little higher 
To talk to you

[chorus]
Because since you've been gone
Things just ain't the same
And though life moves on
Your memory remains
He'll try to be strong to overcome the pain
Of living without you here

[bridge]
I've learned from early on in life
That people come and go
Sometimes we must learn to say goodbye
To those that we have come to love and know
But I never thought I'd see the day
That I'd have to close your door
I guess what I am trying to say
Is I'm not ready to let you go

You should still be here
I guess what I am trying to say
Is I'm not ready to let go

[chorus]
Since you've been gone
Things just ain't the same
And though life moves on
Your memory remains
We'll try to be strong to overcome the pain
Of living without you here

http://pauldateh.com
http://kenbelcher.com

content:

Here's what i hear in my head when i put DJ Shadow's Midnight in a Perfect World together with the jazz standard 'Round Midnight.

--

DJ Shadow - Midnight in a Perfect World
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nmzHRGoKca0

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=DEaDj6TXiQQ

--

Lyrics:

memories always start, always start 'round midnight
it begins to tell i'm out my mind
it gets really bad 'round midnight
when my heart is still with you
and ol' midnight knows it, too

when the memories start
to stand those memories i haven't got the heart
and i'm out my mind
it begins to tell 'round midnight

title: Paul Dateh - Weightless (Original)
content:
I recently celebrated my birthday with a trip to the Long Beach Aquarium of the Pacific. I enjoyed all of the exhibits, but I was especially captivated by the jellyfish. I spent about 30 minutes watching these brainless, heartless creatures gracefully float around in their tanks. I took some video of them to share with you.

title: 4.2.09. questions, answers, and chords
content:
In this week's video, I finally get a chance to answer some of the emails I've received over the past few months. Also, my good friend and guitarist Ken Belcher gives us the chord breakdowns of some of our most popular arrangements.

If you have a question you'd like to ask for me to answer in a future video, feel free to send it to contact[at]pauldateh[dot]com.

Here are the chords progressions that Ken outlines for each piece:

Untitled #1
Gm7 / BbMaj7 / Cm7 / D7
EbMaj7 / D7(#9)

Get Up
BMaj7 / DMaj7 / GMaj7 / CMaj7 / GMaj7

Just Friends

title: Railways - Paul Dateh (Original)
content:
My favorite way to travel is by rail. We have a few rail lines in LA, and I like to take them whenever I can. The Metro Gold Line is one of the nicest with awesome views of DTLA as you travel over the 101 freeway. It's a very calming ride, and I made this track to try and match that vibe.

title: The Good Life - Paul Dateh & Ken Belcher EPK
content:
"the good life" is now available for purchase worldwide!

for physical copies:

cd baby - http://www.cdbaby.com/cd/datehbelcher

for digital download:

itunes - http://itunes.apple.com/us/artist/paul-dateh-ken-belcher/id334602008

amazon mp3 store - http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B002RHHHK0/ref=dm_dp_adp?ie=UTF8&qid=1262906637&sr=8-1

http://pauldateh.com - violin. vocals. writing.
http://kenbelcher.com - guitar. writing.
video by: http://thebuibrothers.com

Since first appearing on the music scene two years ago, singer and violinist Paul Dateh has gone on to garner millions of views on the web as well as national exposure on television and in print. Now, Dateh has teamed up with guitarist Ken Belcher to create The Good Life  a concept record that offers a fresh and original take on acoustic urban folk music.

The Good Life is a seven-song EP that follows the life of a man living out his adulthood. Classic, well-known stories of finding happiness in each moment and the search for love are presented in new ways with Datehs pure voice and lush string harmonies filling in the lines while Belcher punctuates each sentence with the soulful strumming of guitar.

Being fully trained in both Classical and Jazz styles, Paul Dateh & Ken Belchers influences are extremely diverse. Some of their influences include Bela Fleck, Stephane Grappelli, Alan & Marilyn Bergman, Stevie Wonder, and The Clientele.

In preparation for the release of The Good Life, Dateh and Belcher have been touring throughout the United States performing to sold-out crowds while also continuing to build a solid following online. The duo also made their first five-week tour in Japan in November of 2009.

title: 6.19.08. album update: rehearsals
content:
We've been hanging out together online for quite a while now, I have to say that I'm really enjoying getting to know you! Your comments, video responses, and emails frikkin' rock. Thanks for sending them, and keep sending more!

When I open my email inbox, however, there's one question that I see over and over again: "When is the album coming out?"

Due to my touring schedule, the album release has been slightly delayed. Believe me, I really want this album done, but it has to be done right. Out of respect for you, the listener, I want to make sure that I put my best work forward. Please be patient, because I promise it'll be worth the wait.

Significant progress is being made on the project, however. This week, we finished pre-production and are now in rehearsals. We officially begin recording the album next week!

Stay tuned. There's much more video to come in the following weeks.

Best wishes to you and yours,
pd

title: 7.1.08. first international tour
content:
I'm going on my very first international tour. Actually, it's my first tour... ever!

I'll be on the road with Louis Logic and Blueprint for a two-week run throughout the UK and Europe. You can see the full tour schedule on my website at pauldateh.com/tour.

Check out the amazing artists I have the honor of sharing the stage with:

Louis Logic - myspace.com/louislogic
Blueprint - myspace.com/blueprint

While on the road, I'll definitely post as much video as I can. Of course, I'll be uploading photos to Flickr, as well as updating via Twitter.

Yes, going on this tour is the "slight delay" in my album recording that I mentioned in my previous post (6.19.08. album rehearsals). However, nothing has taken my heart away from the album project, and as soon as I get back in town, I'll be right back to recording again. Don't worry, I'll make sure to keep you in the loop with regular project updates. :)

If you happen to live close to any of the cities on the upcoming tour, it would be great to see you at the show! Otherwise, I look forward to continue hanging out with you all online.

Hope you're all having a great day,
pd

title: 12.6.08. tour announcement & album release date
content:
You are now watching: 12.6.08. december news update

Hey everybody,

I know its been a while since my last post, but its not because of a lack of news! :) Let me quickly update you on the latest:

1. tour

I will be touring the U.S. west coast with The Grouch & Eligh of the Living Legends starting Monday, December 8th, 2008. Check the full tour schedule on my MySpace page or right here at http://pauldateh.com/tour.

2. official album release date

I am very excited to announce that I now have an official release date for the album: Tuesday, January 27th, 2009. Youll be able to get the album digitally through iTunes, Amazon, and all the other digital retailers, and you can buy physical copies through CD Baby or directly from me at a live show. Everyone involved in the project worked very hard on it, and I very much look forward to sharing the finished product with you. Thank you for supporting independent music!

3. Be More video shoot

Some of you may be wondering, what happened to the Be More video shoot you mentioned a while back? The video shoot has been postponed due to my touring schedule. As soon as a new date is set, Ill make sure to announce it here (and Ill tell you how you can be involved, too!).

4. Strings Magazine article

Im currently featured in the December issue of Strings Magazine. As a former classical music geek, I grew up reading this magazine, and it is so exciting to now be featured in it! You can read the article online on the Strings website, or if you happen to grab a copy, you can find the article on page 98.

Thats all the news for now. Hope to see you while on tour! If not, you can always keep track of what Im up to on Twitter and Flickr.

Hope youre having a great day, and until next time, Ill see you around online.
pd

title: 6.01.09 free download: whatever i choose
content:
download "whatever i choose" for free at http://pauldateh.bandcamp.com

*don't forget to subscribe!*

hello, everyone. welcome to the 2nd installment of my 10-week album giveaway. if you don't know what i'm talking about, just watch last week's video and you'll be caught up to speed. i hope you enjoyed the first track - "be more" - last week, which now brings us to the number two track on the album. it's called "whatever i choose".

as you might guess from the title, "whatever i choose" is a song about rebellion. and if you already know my backstory, you've probably also figured that this song relates to my experience of moving out of the classical music world and into the world of jazz and other styles of music. choosing to drop my major in classical violin during college raised a lot of challenges in my life; it was definitely a rough transition to say the least. so, in a nutshell, this song is pretty much a three-and-a-half minute "F-U" to everyone that discouraged me from expanding my musical knowledge.

much to the chagrin of my critics, the lyrics of "whatever i choose" are fairly redundant. but what do you expect? i wrote the song during college. and besides, i really, really, really wanted to make sure i got my point across, even to the point of repeating it ad nauseam. i guess, the song is my way of being that rebellious, immature little kid that keeps yelling until everyone hears what he has to say, whether you like it or not.

but, i'll leave that decision of liking it up to you. click that free download link and listen for yourself.

and, as a side note, just know that there is no single, correct way to be a musician. there's nothing wrong with pursuing your passions, and don't let anyone tell you otherwise. after all, music is all about expressing yourself and having fun while doing it.

so that's it for this week. i'll see you right back here next monday for track number three. in the meantime, i will see you around elsewhere online!

title: 5.24.09 get paul dateh's album for free!
content:
*don't forget to subscribe!*

My debut album is now available for purchase!

You can get physical copies at http://cdbaby.com/cd/pauldateh, and digital copies at iTunes, Amazon MP3, and all other digital retailers.

However, you may remember a while back when I said that if you really want to get the album, but just don't have enough cash, I wouldn't punish you for it.

So, I'm making the following announcement today: Over the next ten weeks, I'll be giving my album away for free, one song at a time.

Also, as we go through the album, I'll be giving you background info on each song.

So, let's get everything started! The first track on the album is "Be More", produced by Oren Yoel (you may already know of Oren from his production work on Asher Roth's current debut album).

So, what are you waiting for? Click the download link below to make "Be More" yours today!

Free Download of "Be More" available at http://pauldateh.bandcamp.com

That's it for now. I'll see you back here next week with song number two!

title: Support Paul Dateh on Patreon! You make all the difference!
content:
Become my Patreon at http://patreon.com/pauldateh
YOUR HELP MAKES ALL THE DIFFERENCE. If you become my Patron, you'll be directly helping me create music for you to enjoy!

Hi. My name is Paul. and I'm a musician based in Los Angeles, California, and on the Web. Nothing makes me happier than creating music to share with you, and you can directly help me make that further possible.

YOU CAN SET ANY AMOUNT THAT YOU FEEL COMFORTABLE GIVING. All you need to do is just enter it into the box on the top-left side of this page, and then click "Become a Patron". Enter your payment info, and then whenever I release a new music video, you automatically give me a tip for the amount that you set up in the box.

How often will I upload new videos? I'd like to upload an average of 3 - 4 videos every month. If you're concerned about going over your budget, there's a super easy way to set a monthly maximum for yourself. You'll never have to worry about me breaking the bank, haha!

IF YOU LIKE MY MUSIC, AND YOU WANT ME TO MAKE MORE, PLEASE BE MY PATRON. I have a lot of awesome videos planned for you guys, and I'd really like you to be part of them.

As always, thanks for watching, and thanks for your support.
